SUMMARY: The 105mm Howitzer is a American World War I siege weapon  .
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and anti-tank units.

SUMMARY: The 12 Pounder is a Frankish siege weapon of the Imperial Age , available at the Siege Factory. It is upgraded from the Bombard for 80 Gold .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. buildings and gun infantry.

SUMMARY: The 37mm AA Gun is a Russian World War I anti-air unit .
The 37mm Bofors AA Gun is an anti-air unit of the United Kingdom .
The 77mm AA Gun is a French World War I anti-air unit .

Originally designed as an anti-air gun, the versatile 88 mm gun also saw use as a field weapon. Amazingly, it was also the best anti-tank gun of any army during World War II, able to punch through the thickest armour.[1]
The 88mm AT Gun is a American World War II anti-tank unit . It is upgraded from the Anti-Tank 75mm Gun for 55 Gold .
The 90mm AA Gun is a Russian World War II anti-air unit . It is upgraded from the 37mm AA Gun for 40 Gold .

In response to the success of British tanks in 1916, the German War Ministry issued a secret contract to the VPK to develop the A7V Sturmpanzerwagen. In Empires, the A7V Sturmpanzerwagen acts as Germany's only battle tank in World War I.[1]

The most common Allied WWI Ambulance was a modified Ford Model T, because of its lightweight and strong reliability. WWI was finally a war where medicine caught up close to war. In all previous wars, it was usually wounds or disease that killed more people than actual fatal bullets.[1]
STRENGTHS: Can heal hit points and restore power to surrounding units.

SUMMARY: The American is the American Citizen unit , used to gather resources and to construct and repair buildings. They are created at the Town Center.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. animals. Can construct and repair buildings, and gather resources.

SUMMARY: Amphibious tanks were conceived to ford rivers where bridges were unavailable.[2]
The Anatra-DS Fighter is a Russian World War I fighter plane .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Bombers and land units.

SUMMARY: The Anti-Tank 38mm Gun is a Russian anti-tank unit .
The Anti-Tank 38mm Gun is an anti-tank unit of the United Kingdom .
The Anti-Tank 75mm Gun is a French and American World War I anti-tank unit .
The Anti-Tank 75mm Gun is a French and American World War I anti-tank unit .

The APC, short for Armored Personnal Carrier, was used to keep the infantry from becoming fatigued or getting ambushed while travelling in hostile lands. It was especially important in WWII for the infantry to be able to keep up with the tanks. Today's modern APC was mostly the creation of a Canadian general named Guy Simonds.[1]
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. Tanks and anti-tank units.

SUMMARY: The Archer is the Frankish foot archer . It is trained at the Barracks in the Medieval Age.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. spear units and cavalry archers.

SUMMARY: The USSR Arkhangelsk, as it was later christened, played a small role in Soviet Navy, however, weighing 27,500 tons and armed with eight 15-inch turrets, the Arkhangelsk was certainly not a force to be trifled with.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fighters, Fishing Boats, and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. Submarines and siege weapons.

SUMMARY: Russia ordered a few dozen armored cars from the British Austin Motor Company in 1914 and more in subsequent years. The cars were found to be vulnerable and were given thicker armor at the Putilovski factory in Russia. None of the improved vehicles were ready before Russia withdrew from WWI. After the 1917 Revolutions, however, completed cars fell.[1]
The Arquebusier is an English gun infantry unit .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. gun cavalry and sword infantry.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. sword cavalry and field weapons.

SUMMARY: The Artillerie is a French World War I field weapon . It can fire a smokescreen shell that temporarily lowers the Line of Sight and range of enemies within the smokescreen (100 power, hotkey S).
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and anti-tank units.

SUMMARY: And like its historical counterpart, the Flying Fortress is best used en masse. Where one B-17 will annoy an enemy, a fleet of a six or twelve will ruthlessly destroy most attacking armies or forward cities. Launched from safe havens well back from the front lines, the mighty Boeing might not win the war single-handed, but it will move the American war effort much closer to victory. It's offensive power and defensive durability make the B-17 much more than just another air unit. Properly used, it should be a mainstay of the US war machine.[1]
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. anti-air units and Fighters.

SUMMARY: `Not surprisingly, the successful American player in Empires will be the one who knows when to commit the Superfortress and its atomic payload, and when to hold off and pound the enemy with more conventional attacks, like those from the B-29's smaller sibling, the B-17 "Flying Fortress." Once the target city is sufficiently prepared-and its air defenses seriously weakened or destroyed-the B-29 can then be the true war-winning weapon it was in history. From its glistening silver fuselage to the awesome power of its atomic payload, the Superfortress stands as the very symbol of American power as the United States takes its place as a superpower on the world's stage.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. all land and sea units. Drops an atomic bomb that devastates a large area.
WEAKNESSES: Expensive. Weak vs. anti-air units and Fighters.

SUMMARY: Its Bulldoze ability can inflict heavy damage on an adjacent unit by running over it (100 power, hotkey B).
The Ballista is the Frankish Field Weapon of the Medieval Age , available at the Siege Factory.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. foot archers and buildings.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. sword cavalry and spear cavalry.

SUMMARY: The Barge is the naval support unit of the English , available from the Gunpowder Age onwards. It passively repairs nearby friendly ships, and is able to fire a chain shot to immobilize enemy ships as its special action (50 power, hotkey C).
STRENGTHS: Can repair friendly ships and fire chain shots to immobilize enemy ships.

SUMMARY: The Berserk is the Frankish Heavy Infantry of the Medieval Age . It can be trained from the Barracks. It throws axes that will damage units behind the initial target.
The Big Bertha was the most powerful artillery piece in the world in 1914, able to fire one-ton shells over nine miles. It was named after the wife of the manufacturer’s owner.[1]

The Germans sent the 51,000-ton Bismarck to harass Allied shipping in 1941. The British quickly organized a large naval task force to intercept the mighty battleship. On May 27, battered and unable to return fire, Bismarck capsized 600 miles off the coast of France.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fighters, Fishing Boats, and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. submarines and siege weapons.

SUMMARY: The BL 6 in. Howitzer is a siege weapon of the United Kingdom .
A sophisticated variant of early gunpowder weapons was a bomb with a timed fuse. In addition to mortars, cheaper slings were employed so men could throw bombs a good distance by hand.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. buildings and groups of enemies.

SUMMARY: The Bombard is a Frankish siege weapon of the Gunpowder Age , available at the Siege Factory.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. buildings and gun infantry.

SUMMARY: A number of C-47s were sent from the US to the UK during WWII to act as air transports and paratroop planes. Dakotas dropped troops before dawn on D-Day.[1]

Bridging the often-vast distance between factory and battlefield, the C-47 gives the American player a versatile and dramatic way to take the fight to the enemy. Disregarding terrain and obstacles, the mighty Dakota carries the fight to the enemy, dropping a powerful military force where and when the American player desires, and with no way for the enemy to counter the attack. Once on the ground these forces have to fend for themselves, but their appearance where least expected is sure to discomfort even the most prepared foe. That's to be expected from a plane with as storied a history as the C-47, though. From North Africa to Normandy to Holland and into Germany, such heroic transport missions were the Dakota's bread and butter. In Empires, it continues this historic task.[1]

In an era when airpower is still in its formative period, and defenses are not yet fully developed, the Caproni offers the Americans a chance to break the deadlock of grinding ground offensives. Striking deep into enemy territory, more than a match for the primitive fighter planes of the era, these Italian stallions in American service show their thoroughbred lineage. Used in quantity, relying on their ability to absorb punishment and hit targets again and again, the Ca.36 should be a familiar sight in the skies above American territory-and the territory of the United States' enemies.[1]
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. anti-air units and Fighters.

SUMMARY: The Carabineer is a Frankish gun cavalry unit .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. sword cavalry and spear infantry.

SUMMARY: Perhaps the best known French Cardinal is Cardinal Richelieu, who became France's Prime Minister under King Louis XIII in 1624. He is generally credited with helping to re-establish France as a strong European power in the 17th Century.[1]
STRENGTHS: Can see stealthy enemies, destroy buildings, and infect units.
WEAKNESSES: No attack. Countered by any unit.

SUMMARY: The Cavalier is the English sword cavalry of the Gunpowder Age , trained from the Stable.
STRENGTHS: Strong vs. gun infantry and foot archers.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. gun cavalry and spear infantry.

SUMMARY: The Ch'ing Musketeer is the Chinese gun infantry unit of the Imperial Age . It is upgraded from the Flintlock Infantry for 20 Gold , and can be trained at the War Camp.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. gun cavalry, spear infantry, and sword infantry.
WEAKNESSES: weak vs. sword cavalry and field weapons.

SUMMARY: The Chevalier is the Frankish spear cavalry of the Medieval Age , trained at the Stable. It can call a Noble Charge to temporarily increase the speed of nearby allied units (50 power, hotkey 50).
The Choson Battleship is the ultimate Korean battleship of the Imperial Age , available to upgrade from the Turtle Boat for 95 Gold . It can transport land units across water.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fishing Boats and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. siege weapons and other Battleships.

SUMMARY: The Choson Flail Cavalry is the Korean sword cavalry of the Gunpowder Age , available at the Stable. It is upgraded from the Mounted Flail for 75 Gold .
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. spear infantry and gun cavalry.

SUMMARY: Like other Korean infantry, it can use Martial Arts to temporarily increase its speed and rate of attack, which will afterwards decrease in a short recovery period (100 power, hotkey M).
STRENGTHS: Good vs. spear infantry and gun cavalry.

SUMMARY: The Choson Sword Cavalry is a Korean sword cavalry unit . It is upgraded from the Choson Flail Cavalry for 75 Gold .
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. spear infantry and gun cavalry.

SUMMARY: Its attack can stun cavalry. Like other Korean infantry, it can also use Martial Arts to temporarily increase its speed and rate of attack, which will afterwards decrease in a short recovery period (100 power, hotkey M).
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. archers and gun infantry.

SUMMARY: Known in Chinese as a Chu-Ko-Nu, this "repeating crossbow" held a magazine of bolts that could be fired in rapid succession.[1]
The Cog Warship is the Frankish battleship of the Medieval Age , built at the Dock.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fishing Boats and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. siege weapons and other Battleships.

SUMMARY: The British army units originally used for small attacks on enemy beaches were called Commandos. These units were used all over the world during the war from Africa to France. Their secret and dangerous missions often were paramount to future operations.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Citizens. Stealthy, detects stealthy units, and can climb cliffs and traverse forests.

SUMMARY: Commissars were appointed to Red Army units to spread propaganda and ensure loyalty to the communist government.[1]
STRENGTHS: Can throw Molotov Cocktails, encourage allied units, and see stealthy units.

SUMMARY: Chinese Commoners can construct siege and field weapons: the Fork Cart in the Medieval and Gunpowder Age, the Siege Crossbow in the Gunpowder and Imperial Age, and the Barbarian Cannon in the Imperial Age. They can also forecast a Monsoon, which creates an area with heavy rain and wind that slows down enemy land and sea units, and damages air units. The player can control the Monsoon like a unit (75 power, hotkey M).
STRENGTHS: Good vs. animals. Can construct and repair buildings, and gather resources.

SUMMARY: Some young Chinese men, not unlike knightly squires, were called upon to serve a man of higher rank. It became their sworn duty to protect their lords, even bearing a shield for them into battle.[1]
The Comrade can turn into a Revolutionary for 175 Wood . Revolutionaries can self-detonate, causing widespread damage.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. animals. Can construct and repair buildings, and gather resources.

SUMMARY: In the Soviet Union, military service was compulsory for all males once they turned 18. These conscripts were usually poorly trained, inexperienced youths, who fought to their deaths for the Motherland. In Empires, Conscripts remain true to their real life counterparts. Armed only with their fallen comrade's rifle, these weak infantry troops can be produced in great numbers relatively cheaply.[1]
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and field weapons.

SUMMARY: The Cossacks settled southern Ukraine in the 15th Century, trading military service in return for political autonomy. They were reactivated to fight in both world wars.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. gun infantry and Citizens.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and anti-tank units.

SUMMARY: The Courbet Battleship is a French World War I battleship .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fighters, Fishing Boats, and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. submarines and siege weapons.

SUMMARY: The Crossbowman is an English foot archer . The Flaming Bolt ability sets its target on fire, doing continual damage over time (75 power, hotkey F).
In 1095 Pope Urban II travelled to France, urging the Franks to launch holy war to retake the Holy Lands from the Muslims.[1]

The Crusader tank was the standard tank for British forces for much of World War II with over five thousand made. It eventually was retired after the Cromwell Tank was made. The early models were quickly outclassed by the Axis leading to the creation of the Crusader II.[1]
The Cuirassier is the English gun cavalry of the Gunpowder Age , trained from the Stable.
The Culverin is an English field weapon, available from the Gunpowder Age on . It is able to use the Bombardment ability, allowing it to fire over walls like a siege weapon.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. spear and gun infantry.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. sword and spear cavalry.

SUMMARY: The D-2 Submarine is a Russian submarine of World War I , available to be built from the Dock. It is stealthy and can detect other stealthy units.
The Dewoitine Fighter is a French World War II fighter aircraft . It is upgraded from the Spad XIII Fighter for 95 Gold .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Bombers and land units. Can detect stealthy units.

SUMMARY: The Dogs is a German World War I scout unit . It has a good Line of Sight, and can pass through forests.

The Doughboys have a long history. The Doughboys were the men America sent to France in the Great War, and fought to make the world safe for democracy. The expression doughboy, though, was in wide circulation a century before the First World War in both Britain and America, albeit with some very different meanings. Because of the occasional contact of the two nation's armed force and transatlantic migration, it seems likely that this usage was known to the members of the U.S. Army by the early 19th century. In the end, it was established that a "doughboy" was an American infantryman in World War 1.[1]
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and field weapons.

SUMMARY: The Dragoon is the English gun cavalry of the Imperial Age , trained from the Stable. It is upgraded from the Cuirassier for 75 Gold .
The Corps of Engineers was formed in 1802. In World War I, the first US troops in Europe were engineers. They helped construct rail lines, roads, bridges and other structure.[1]
STRENGTHS: Can repair mechanical ground units, capture enemy buildings, lay mine fields, and detect stealthy units.

SUMMARY: The Falcon is the flying scout unit of the Koreans . It is available from the Medieval Age onward, and is trained at the Town Center.
STRENGTHS: Flying unit with god line of sight.
WEAKNESSES:
Cannot attack.
Weak vs. archers and towers.

SUMMARY: Late models of the fire cart were capable of firing 100 rocket arrows almost simultaneously, causing havoc among an enemy formation unlucky enough to be caught in the weapon’s fearsome hail of missiles.[1]
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. sword and spear cavalry.

SUMMARY: Before the preeminence of cannon, one of the most effective ship-based weapons was Greek fire. This flammable liquid streamed from a nozzle mounted on a ship’s deck and burst into flame on enemy targets.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fishing Boats and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. Battleships and siege weapons.

SUMMARY: Introduced to Korea by China, fire oxen were live animals fitted with explosives. Troops stampeded the unfortunate creatures toward enemy lines, where they exploded in spectacular fashion.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs spear infantry, sword cavalry, and Citizens.

SUMMARY: The Fishing Bateau is the French Fishing Ship , built at the Dock. It gathers fish and returns to the nearest Dock.
The Fishing Bateau is the Frankish Fishing Ship , built at the Dock. It gathers fish and returns to the nearest Dock.
The Fishing Bateau is the Frankish Fishing Ship , built at the Dock. It gathers fish and returns to the nearest Dock.

Its attack can stun cavalry. Like other Korean infantry, it can also use Martial Arts to temporarily increase its speed and rate of attack, which will afterwards decrease in a short recovery period (100 power, hotkey M).
The Flamethrower is a French World War I heavy infantry unit .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. buildings, Citizens, and Scouts.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and anti-tank units.

SUMMARY: The Chinese Flintlock Infantry were small infantry groups which had guns or pistols with a Flintlock. Flintlocks were a lock for a pistol that had a flint in the hammer for striking a spark to ignite the charge. A flint was massive hard quartz, which produced a spark when struck by steel. This fired the gun.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. gun cavalry, spear infantry, and sword infantry.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. sword cavalry and field weapons.

SUMMARY: The Foochow Battleship is the Chinese battleship of the Gunpowder Age . It is available to be upgraded from Flying Tiger Warship for 50 Gold  and can be built from the Dock.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fishing Boats and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. other battleships and siege weapons.

SUMMARY: The Fork Cart is a Chinese Medieval Age siege weapon  that is built by Commoners. It is effective against buildings, walls, towers, and ships, but cannot attack land units.
The Freedom Fighter is a French scout unit of World War I '.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. Tanks and anti-tank units.

SUMMARY: The FT-17 Renault was a French tank made around 1917 as a light, cheap, and easy to produce tank. The tank quickly proved itself, used mostly as forerunner of the infantry. It was the first tank of it's kind, whose model would by used for all future tank including its 360 degree turret gun, the first for tanks. After the war, many countries including the US would import and create their own modified FT-17s.[1]
The Fusilier is a Frankish gun infantry unit .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. gun cavalry, spear infantry, and sword infantry.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. sword cavalry and field weapons.

SUMMARY: The term "G.I." originally meant galvanized iron but in World War I, it was used to describe any "Government Issued" items and finally "General Infantry." This is a general term to describe any American infantry. During World War II, most American infantry would normally carry a M1 Carbine, M1 Garand, a Browning Automatic Rifle, or a Thompson submachine gun. Weapons of a G.I. would vary depending on specific role, terrain, and climate. But all the noted weapons are either semi or fully automatic, giving the G.I. an advantage over your average army of the time.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and field weapons.

SUMMARY: Korea and the United States signed a formal treaty of friendship in 1882. Exchanges between the two countries followed, and modern weapons, such as the Gatling gun, were brought to Korea in an effort to modernize her military.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good against gun and spear infantry.

SUMMARY: Korea and the United States signed a formal treaty of friendship in 1882. Exchanges between the two countries followed, and modern weapons, such as the Gatling gun, were brought to Korea in an effort to modernize her military.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good against gun and spear infantry.

SUMMARY: The Grenadier is a Frankish gun infantry unit . It is upgraded from the Fusilier for 35 Gold .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. gun cavalry, spear infantry, and sword infantry.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. sword cavalry and field weapons.

SUMMARY: The Handly Page Bomber is a World War I bomber plane of the United Kingdom .
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. anti-air units and Fighters.

SUMMARY: The Heavy Artillery is a Russian World War I field weapon .
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and anti-tank units.

SUMMARY: As the cornerstone of a seagoing air force, the Hellcat is an aircraft that Empire players will come to love, or fear, depending on which side they are playing. Capable of striking land, air, and naval targets with equal ease, and launching from mobile and hard to catch carrier forces, the F6F can change the course of a game, just as it helped the USN change the course of the Pacific war against Japan.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. bombers and land units.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. anti-air units and gun infantry.

SUMMARY: The Higgins Boat is a American World War I transport ship .
STRENGTHS: Can transport land units across water.

SUMMARY: Only the clan leaders - the "knights" of Scotland's patchwork social structure -- could afford a Claymore, a helmet, and a coat of mail, and they spent more time squabbling amongst themselves than they did working to turn Scotland into a unified nation. But when the English tried to conquer the Highlands, they stood united. And there were many such men who brought to the battlefield some measure of Wallace's integrity, courage, and charisma; under such commanders, even an army of half-starved peasants could fight like lions.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. sword and spear infantry.

SUMMARY: The Dreadnought brought a new era in battleship design demanding bigger, better, and more guns. The Dreadnought was so influential that all previous battleships were named Pre-Dreadnoughts. The Dreadnought was actually the product of a naval race which happened before WWI leading to the expansion of many of the world's battleships.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fighters, Fishing Boats, and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. Submarines and siege weapons.

SUMMARY: One battleship can be designated to be the Flagship, which means it can fire Incendiary Shells.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fighters, Fishing Boats, and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. submarines and siege weapons.

SUMMARY: In the Napoleonic Wars, General LaSalle, perhaps the greatest cavalry commander of the war, commanded the 5th and 7th Hussars, called the "Brigade Infernale". In 1806, LaSalle and 900 Hussars captured a fortress and some 6,000 Prussians without firing a shot.[1]
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. gun cavalry and spear infantry.

SUMMARY: The Ilya Mourmetts Bomber is a Russian World War I bomber .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. anti-tank units and infantry.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. anti-air units and Fighters.

SUMMARY: The Infanterie is the French gun infantry of World War II , upgraded from the Poilu for 35 Gold  and trained at the Barracks.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and field weapons.

SUMMARY: The K-class Sub is a World War I submarine of the United Kingdom . It is a stealthy unit that can detect other stealthy units.

Katyusha rocket launcher's were mounted on Zis-6 trucks, and later on Studebakers sent from the US. With good speed and terrifying firepower, this mobile rocket launcher was much feared by the German infantry.[1]
The Knight is the English spear cavalry of the Medieval Age , trained from the Stable.
The Koryo Battleship is the Korean battleship of the Medieval Age . It can transport unit, and can later be upgraded to the Turtle Boat in the Gunpowder Age.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fishing Boats and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. siege weapons and other Battleships.

SUMMARY: The Hwarang were young men of the aristocracy, well educated and trained in martial arts to become elite warrior.[1]

The Koryo Spearman is the Korean spear infantry of the Medieval Age , available to be trained at the Barracks. Its attack can stun cavalry. Like other Korean infantry, it can also use Martial Arts to temporarily increase its speed and rate of attack, which will afterwards decrease in a short recovery period (100 power, hotkey M).

During this time, versions of the T-26 light tank (OT-26, OT-130 and OT-133) were used as flamethrower tanks. However they were too weak and too light. The experience of the Winter War showed that flame tanks became the first targets for any anti-tank defense. That's why more powerful and better protected tanks were needed.[2]
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. anti-tank units and tanks.

SUMMARY: The König Battleship is the German battleship of World War I, built at the Dock . It can later be upgraded to the Bismarck in World War II.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fighters, Fishing Boats, and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. Submarines and siege weapons.

SUMMARY: La Couronne is the Frankish battleship of the Gunpowder Age . It is upgraded from the Cog Warship for 80 Gold  and is built at the Dock.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fishing Boats and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. siege weapons and other Battleships.

SUMMARY: The Lancaster Bomber is a World War II bomber plane of the United Kingdom . It is upgraded from the Handly Page Bomber for 165 Gold .
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. anti-air units and Fighters.

SUMMARY: The Lancer is the English sword cavalry of the Imperial Age , trained from the Stable. It is upgraded from the Cavalier for 65 Gold .
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. gun cavalry and spear infantry.

SUMMARY: The Lancier is a Frankish Sword Cavalry from the Imperial Age , available to upgraded from the Hussar for 75 Gold  and trained at the Stable.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. spear infantry and gun cavalry.

SUMMARY: The Leo 451 Bomber is a French World War II bomber aircraft . It is upgraded from the Voisin V Bomber for 140 Gold .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. anti-tank units and infantry.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. anti-air units and Fighters.

SUMMARY: The Leo 451 Bomber is a French World War II bomber aircraft . It is upgraded from the Voisin V Bomber for 140 Gold .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. anti-tank units and infantry.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. anti-air units and Fighters.

SUMMARY: Such defensive prowess had a price, of course. While advancing with shields raised, the Longswordman were vulnerable to enemy melee attack, and his slower speed put him at particular risk from the enemy's cavalry. While rarely the unit of choice for sweeping maneuvers, the medieval Longswordman could drive stolidly into an adversary, presenting a potent melding of offensive and defensive strengths. Moving forward with the inexorable weight of England's expectations, these knights without horses made a very profitable trade of speed for protection , and laid the groundwork for converting an island to an Empire.[1]
The Lorraine Battleship is a French World War II battleship . It is upgraded from the Courbet Battleship for 95 Gold .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fighters, Fishing Boats, and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. submarines and siege weapons.

SUMMARY: The Louis Royale is the Frankish Battleship of the Imperial Age , available to be upgraded from the La Couronne battleship for 80 Gold . It is built at the Dock.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fishing Boats and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. siege weapons and other Battleships.

SUMMARY: The Man-At-Arms is the Frankish Sword Infantry of the Medieval Age , trained at the Barracks.
The Manchu Spearman is the Chinese spear infantry unit of the Imperial Age . It is upgraded from the Ming Spearman for 30 Gold , and can be trained at the War Camp.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. sword infantry and cavalry.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. gun infantry and cavalry.

SUMMARY: Tanks were developed to overcome the trench warfare of WWI, a concept championed by First Lord of the Admiralty, Winston Churchill. The word "tank" comes from a ruse; parts for the vehicles were packed in crates labelled “tanks” to disguise their true purpose.[1]

The Matchlock Infantry is the Korean gun infantry of the Gunpowder Age , available to be trained at the Barracks. Like other Korean infantry, it can use Martial Arts to temporarily increase its speed and rate of attack, which will afterwards decrease in a short recovery period (100 power, hotkey M).
STRENGTHS: Good vs. spear infantry and gun cavalry.

SUMMARY: An integrated British medical corps was founded in 1898 and given the name Royal Army Medical Corps. Members of the Corps have received numerous decorations for valour.[1]
STRENGTHS: Can heal friendly troops and revive mortally wounded troops.

SUMMARY: The MG42 Team is a German World War II gun infantry unit , available at the Barracks.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and field weapons.

SUMMARY: The Ming Cavalry is a Chinese sword cavalry unit .
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. gun cavalry and spear infantry.

SUMMARY: The Ming Spearman is the Chinese spear infantry unit of the Gunpowder Age . It is upgraded from the Song Spearman for 20 Gold , and can be trained at the War Camp.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. sword infantry and cavalry.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. gun units and cavalry archers.

SUMMARY: The Mongols poured out of the north and ultimately took over China, creating the Yuan Dynasty in the 13th Century. Mongol horsemen were exceptional archers, with bows effective to a range of 300 yards.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. spear infantry and cavalry.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. foot archers, sword infantry, and sword cavalry.

SUMMARY: The Monk is a Korean priest . It can convert enemy units (which costs 125 power, hotkey C) and detect stealthy enemies. It can also cast Bad Karma, which contaminates a group of enemies, decreasing hit points over time (200 power, hotkey K).
STRENGTHS: Can convert enemy units, detect stealthy units, and give enemies Bad Karma.

SUMMARY: The French used the Montgolfier balloon for military observation and at times even for attack purposes, bringing death from above. In Empires, the Montgolfier Balloon will demoralize enemy troops with awe and fright as it floats over the battlefield.[1]
STRENGTHS: Can detect stealthy units and drop leaflets to reduce enemy attack.
WEAKNESSES: Cannot attack. Weak vs. gun units.

SUMMARY: The Mounted Flail is the Korean sword cavalry of the Medieval Age , available at the Stable.
The Mounted Grenadier is a Frankish gun cavalry unit . It is upgraded from the Carabineer for 65 Gold .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. sword cavalry and spear infantry.

SUMMARY: Grenadiers were professional infantry troops within the Wehrmacht, and were one of the most heavily armed troops in the world, and thanks to their equipment, they were very versatile, able to adapt to any situation thanks to their training, due to this, there were many different types of Grenadiers, each with different duties.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and field weapons.

SUMMARY: The Oil Smithy is an English field weapon of the Medieval Age , trained from the Siege Factory. It is better against groups than single units. Its Boiling Oil ability engulfs a target location in a river of flaming oil (50 power, hotkey V).
The Ordnance 17 pdr AT is a World War II anti-tank unit of the United Kingdom . It is upgraded from the Anti-Tank 38mm Gun for 65 Gold .

Sleek, powerful, and modern, the P-51 represented the apex of the US Army Air Force's conventional fighter plane development in World War II. Serving into the Korean War, the Mustang became one of the most successful and famous aircraft in history, and for good reason. As is also true in Empires, the P-51 was capable of any task, any where, at any time, and came to dominate the skies wherever it flew.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Bombers and land units.

SUMMARY: The PE-2 Bomber is a Russian World War II bomber . It is upgraded from the Ilya Mourmetts Bomber for 100 Gold .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. anti-tank units and infantry.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. anti-air units and Fighters.

SUMMARY: Peasants can garrison in towers, and can also become infantry units. This costs 50 Food ,  75 Gold , hotkey M, and turns the Peasant into a Man-At-Arms or Fusilier.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. animals. Can construct and repair buildings, and gather resources.

SUMMARY: It can be upgraded to the Arkhangelsk Battleship in World War II.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fighters, Fishing Boats, and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. Submarines and siege weapons.

SUMMARY: The Poilu is the basic gun infantry of the French in World War I . The Poliu is the second strongest gun infantry in World War I, behind the German Soldat. Polius also have high HP, and therefore will take more hits before they die.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and field weapons.

SUMMARY: The Powder Keg Cart is a Korean support unit . It can use Power Keg (100 power, hotkey P) to blow up the enemy's stone and gold mines, which means they have to be cleared before mining can resume. It also restores power to nearby friendly units.
STRENGTHS: Can collapse mines and restore power to nearby units.

SUMMARY: The Regular is an English gun infantry unit . It is upgraded from the Arquebusier for 40 Gold .
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. sword cavalry and field weapons.

SUMMARY: Its Bulldoze ability can inflict heavy damage on an adjacent unit by running over it (100 power, hotkey B).
Its Bulldoze ability can inflict heavy damage on an adjacent unit by running over it (100 power, hotkey B).
French cannons in the 14th and 15th centuries were more advanced than their English counterparts. The multi-barrel Ribaud (also know as the ribaudequin) was the machine gun of the 15th century.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. gun infantry and buildings.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. sword cavalry and spear infantry.

SUMMARY: The Rifled Grenadier is a French World War I heavy infantry unit . It can fire a smokescreen shell that temporarily lowers the Line of Sight and range of enemies within the smokescreen (100 power, hotkey S).
STRENGTHS: Good vs. tanks and anti-tank units.

SUMMARY: A Chuhwa was essentially a rocket launcher wielded by a man on horseback. It had tremendous firepower.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. sword cavalry and buildings.

SUMMARY: It can plant time bombs which explode for massive damage unless destroyed (1,000 Gold , hotkey N), demolish a building or vehicle (75 power, hotkey D), or plant an explosive charge to destroy mineral deposits, requiring them to be cleared before mining can resume (100 power, hotkey E).
STRENGTHS: Stealthy unit with various useful abilities.
WEAKNESSES: Cannot attack; weak vs. any unit.

SUMMARY: In North Africa, SAS raids destroyed hundreds of German aircraft and disrupted supply lines. SAS operatives also collaborated with the French Résistance, organizing numerous raids to sabotage supply trains,fuel depots and other strategic targets.[1]
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and field weapons.

SUMMARY: The Sherman Tank is an American World War II unit . It is upgraded from the FT-17 Light Tank for 120 Gold .

A double-bow crossbow uses a second bow to increase the force imparted to the projectile. After the Chinese invented gunpowder, they created incendiary projectiles that exploded against the target.[1]
The Sniper is a Russian gun infantry unit of World War I . It can kill infantry and cavalry units in one shot.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. infantry, Scouts, and Citizens.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and anti-tank units.

SUMMARY: The Soldats is a German World War I gun infantry unit . Well-equipped and disciplined, they are more than capable of engaging on other infantry and light vehicles. Soldats can be upgraded into Neuer Soldats once the player reaches World War II.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. tanks and field weapons.

SUMMARY: The Song Guardsman is the basic sword infantry of China in the Medieval Age .
WEAKNESSES: Countered by spear infantry and cavalry.

SUMMARY: The Song Spearman is the Chinese spear infantry of the Medieval Age . It can be trained at the War Camp.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. sword infantry and cavalry.

SUMMARY: Sopwith Camels had more kills than any other Allied plane during World War I. Like many of the planes during World War I, the Camel was a biplane with two machine guns placed at the front, which would become standard on all planes in later years. Although the Sopwith Camel performed extremely well, it also killed quite a few of its inexperienced pilots. It is also credited with shooting down the infamous Red Baron.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Bombers and land units.

SUMMARY: The crews of all French aircraft repair damage and try to parachute to safety if the plane is shot down.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Bombers and land units. Can detect stealthy units.

SUMMARY: There were some 40 different variants of the Spitfire produced throughout the war and soon after. They served in every combat area, operating as fighters, fighter-bombers, reconnaissance aircraft and carrier-based fighters with the Royal Navy. The Spitfire sported 4 x .303 MG's and 2 x 20mm wing mounted cannons, and could support an external bomb load of one 226 kg or two 113 kg.[2]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Bombers and land units.

SUMMARY: The SU-57 AT Halftrack is a Russian World War II anti-tank unit .
Subjects do not construct buildings like other Citizens; instead, they only initiate construction, and the Mason's Guild automatically finishes construction.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. animals. Can construct and repair buildings, and gather resources.

SUMMARY: The Surcouf Sub is a French World War I submarine .
The Surcouf Sub is a French World War I submarine .

Runstedt called the T-34 the "best tank in the world" and von Kleist said it was the "finest in the world." The T-34 had a more powerful cannon than German tanks, a higher top speed (32 MPH versus 25 MPH), and superior sloped armor and superior welded construction. However, the German Tiger and Panther tanks outranged the T-34's original 76 mm gun, and subsequently a 85 mm gun was mounted on a T-34 tank.[1]

The Song were perhaps first to employ a gunpowder weapon at sea. Sailors loaded a simple wooden boat with black powder, guided it toward an enemy vessel, then jumped off as it rammed the enemy and explode.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fishing Boats and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. Battleships and siege weapons.

SUMMARY: The Thunder Crash Mortar is a Korean siege weapon . It can use Cannonade to increase its range at the cost of accuracy and movement.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. buildings and gun infantry.

SUMMARY: The Tibetan Cavalry is the Chinese sword cavalry unit of the Imperial Age . It is upgraded from the Ming Cavalry for 50 Gold , and can be trained at the War Camp.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. gun cavalry and spear infantry.

SUMMARY: The Tommy is the standard infantry unit of the British Army in World War I and World War II . The Tommy is a decent infantry unit that can overcome any infantry but German Soldats. It has no upgrade in WW2, but can still pack a punch in sheer numbers, given their cost.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. Tanks and field weapons.

SUMMARY: Prince Louis of France brought the trebuchet to England in the early 13th Century. Trebuchets were the ultimate siege weapons of their day, launching 300 pound stones and even decaying animals a great  distance. Legend says the 14th Century outbreak of the Black Death began at the Siege of Caffe, when attackers lobbed plague-ridden corpse into the town.[1]
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. spear and sword cavalry.

SUMMARY: The turtle ship was the creation of Admiral Yi Sun-sin. The deck of the ship has a metal curved cover giving a turtle look with hundreds of swords penetrating the metal, making it impossible for any man to stand on. Cannons cover the side of the ship as well. This odd battleship was used against a Japanese invasion in 100 to 1 odds with the Koreans victorious.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fishing Boats and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. siege weapons and other Battleships.

SUMMARY: Weak vs. spear infantry and gun cavalry.

The Twin-Swordsman is the Korean sword infantry from the Medieval Age , available to be trained at the Barracks. Like other Korean infantry, it can use Martial Arts to temporarily increase its speed and rate of attack, which will afterwards decrease in a short recovery period (100 power, hotkey M).

German submarines or “U-boats” took a heavy toll on Allied shipping in both World War I and World War II. A number of designs were put into production to fill various roles. The Type VIIB U-boat was a very successful attack-sub during World War II. The VIIB carried more fuel and was a bit faster than its predecessor, the Type VIIA, and also had a second rudder for better manoeuvrability. Like the VIIA, the VIIB was armed with four torpedo tubes in the bow and one aft, but it carried three additional torpedoes for a total of 14. Twenty-four VIIB U-boats were built from 1936 to 1940, when the slightly larger VIIC went into production. U-48, the most successful U-boat of the war, was a Type VIIB. Commissioned in April 1939, she sank 52 ships and damaged 4 more for total loss of more than 300,000 tons of shipping. U-48 was scuttled in May 1945, as part of Operation Regenbogen to keep the German fleet from falling into the hands of the Allies at the end of the war.[1]

In Empires, USS Arkansas gives the American player a strong advantage at sea. In addition to being a powerful naval unit in its own right, fully capable of standing up to enemy battleships in head to head combat, she also serves as the center of a strong anti-submarine force. Representing the core of a hunter-killer task force, USS Arkansas has the technological capability to use sonar to detect enemy submarines. Once detected, these stealthy vessels can then be engaged and destroyed, and the seas made safe for American warships and transports. Just as the historical ship served in two world wars and engaged in a variety of combat activities, in Empires USS Arkansas is a flexible and powerful unit that epitomizes the US Navy's tradition of innovation, enterprise, and valor at sea.[1]
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. Submarines and siege weapons.

In addition to being a powerful naval unit in its own right, fully capable of standing up to enemy battleships in head to head combat, she also serves as the center of a strong anti-submarine force. Representing the core of a hunter-killer task force, USS Arkansas has the technological capability to use sonar to detect enemy submarines. Once detected, these stealthy vessels can then be engaged and destroyed, and the seas made safe for American warships and transports. Just as the historical ship served in two world wars and engaged in a variety of combat activities, in Empires USS Arkansas is a flexible and powerful unit that epitomizes the US Navy's tradition of innovation, enterprise, and valor at sea.[1]

WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. Submarines and siege weapons.

SUMMARY: One battleship can be designated to be the Flagship, which can fire heated shots.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fishing Boats and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. siege weapons and other battleships.

SUMMARY: The Voisin V Bomber is a French World War I bomber aircraft .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. anti-tank units and infantry.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. anti-air units and Fighters.

SUMMARY: The War Cog is the English battleship of the Medieval Age , built at the Dock. One battleship can be designated to be the Flagship, which can fire heated shots.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fishing Boats and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. siege weapons and other battleships.

SUMMARY: The War Junk is the Chinese battleship of the Imperial Age . It is available to be upgraded from Foochow Battleship for 50 Gold  and can be built from the Dock.
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Fishing Boats and Transports.
WEAKNESSES: Weak vs. other battleships and siege weapons.

SUMMARY: By creating what is, in effect, the world's first "air force", you're sending a powerful message to friend and foe alike.[1]
STRENGTHS: Good against all melee units. Detects stealthy units.
WEAKNESSES: Countered by gun infantry, gun cavalry, and towers.

SUMMARY: The Yak-1 Fighter is a Russian World War II fighter plane . It is upgraded from the Anatra-DS Fighter for 85 Gold .
STRENGTHS: Good vs. Bombers and land units.

SUMMARY: Since they derive their "lift" from extremely flammable hydrogen gas, Zeppelins are quite vulnerable to AA bursts or tracer-bullet hits from enemy fighters. All told, the German Airship Service mounted a total of 139 raids over Britain, killing 537 people and causing almost eight million dollars' in property damage.[1]
